functional.title: Urxnium CLI
functional.description: Command for free and free application development assistance

elements.name: init
elements.description: Command to initialize a documentation with Urxnium Doc

exampleCodes.title: Command
exampleCodes.description: This command creates the index file of the documentation. In order to create the documentation, it is necessary to answer if we want it to be of type REST, Functional or both.
exampleCodes.out:
? please select a documentation type
   REST
   Functional
   Both

exampleCodes.title: Structure resulting
exampleCodes.description: At the end of this command it will result in a file in the following structure

exampleCodes.title: Resulting file
exampleCodes.description: The file resulting from the selected option will vary as follows.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Title of the REST documentation

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Description of REST documentation

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description: Icon in URL pointing to a .svg file

attributes.name: version
attributes.description: REST documentation version

attributes.name: bookmarks
attributes.description: Identifier for REST documentation [NOT ACTIVE]

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: This field should not be edited, the routes are generated through the CLI

attributes.name: baseUrl [REST]
attributes.description: URL of the domain where REST requests are made in development mode

attributes.name: baseUrlProd [REST]
attributes.description: URL of the domain where REST requests are made in production mode

attributes.name: credentials [REST]
attributes.description: This field should not be edited, the route is generated through the CLI

elements.name: start
elements.description: Command to start a server where the documentation generated by Urxnium Doc can be viewed. This command will be aware of the different changes that the documentation may undergo and will recompile the files whenever necessary.

elements.name: dist
elements.description: Command to generate the Urxnium Doc distributable files. When this command is executed some functions such as authentication, they change to maintain the security of the REST api.

exampleCodes.title: Command
exampleCodes.description: When it finishes executing the command, it will result in a folder called [dist], which must be mounted on a server to be able to see the documentation in production mode.

elements.name: add
elements.description: Command to add [sections], [documents] and [credentials] to the documentation that will be generated.

exampleCodes.title: Command
exampleCodes.description: This command can be used with the following options

attributes.name: section | s
attributes.description: Command that automatically generates section files

attributes.name: document | d
attributes.description: Command that automatically generates document files

attributes.name: credential | d
attributes.description: Command that automatically generates credential files

elements.name: add section | s
elements.description: Command to generate a section of the documentation in Urxnium Doc.

exampleCodes.title: Command
exampleCodes.description: This command generates a new section file in the Urxnium Doc documentation. These sections will be displayed as a section title in the documentation.
exampleCodes.out: ? what is the section name ? [type your section name]

exampleCodes.title: Structure resulting
exampleCodes.description: At the end of this command, it results in a file within the following structure

exampleCodes.title: Resulting file
exampleCodes.description: At the end of this command it will result in a file like the following

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: It is the name that the section will have

attributes.name: elements
attributes.description: This field should not be edited, the route is generated through the CLI

elements.name: add document | d
elements.description: Command to generate a document of the documentation in Urxnium Doc.

exampleCodes.title: Command
exampleCodes.description: This command generates a new document file in the Urxnium Doc documentation. These documents are the cards that contain all the information necessary to document the code in detail.
exampleCodes.out:
? in which section will you add this document ?
  [The sections you can select will appear here]

  ? what is the [REST | functionality] name ?
  [write here the name of your document]

  ? what is the [REST | functionality] access type ?
  [select the type of functionality or REST service that you are going to document]

exampleCodes.title: Structure resulting
exampleCodes.description: At the end of this command, it results in a file within the following structure
exampleCodes.code:
.urxdoc/
  └── [your section folder]
      ├── [your section file].json
      └── [your new document].[rest | functional].json

exampleCodes.title: Resulting file
exampleCodes.description: At the end of this command it will result in a file like the following
exampleCodes.code:
//This object will be output if the documentation is of type Functional
{
  "name": "",
  "access": "",
  "bookmark": "",
  "description": "",
  "html": null,
  "exampleCodes": [ ExampleCode ],
  "attributes": [ Attribute ]
}

//This object will be output if the documentation is of type REST
{
  "name": "",
  "authorization": false,
  "mapping": "",
  "access": "",
  "bookmark": "",
  "permissions": [],
  "description": "",
  "html": null,
  "responseOk": { },
  "responseBadRequest": { },
  "responseUnauthorized": { },
  "responseInternalServerError": { },
  "requestBody": { },
  "pathVariables": [ PathVariable ]
}

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: This is the name that the documentation will bear

attributes.name: authorization [REST]
attributes.description: Indicates if the service will use an authorization token

attributes.name: mapping [REST]
attributes.description: This is the Endpoint to which the request is made

attributes.name: access
attributes.description: This field does not have to be modified, it is generated by Urxnium CLI

attributes.name: bookmark
attributes.description: This mark is placed to categorize the documentation

attributes.name: permissions [REST]
attributes.description: This is an array of the role names that are needed to consume the service

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: This will be the description of the documentation

attributes.name: html
attributes.description: In this field you can include HTML for specific documentation

attributes.name: responseOk [REST]
attributes.description: This field is the OK response type of the service

attributes.name: responseBadRequest [REST]
attributes.description: This field is the bat request response type of the service

attributes.name: responseUnauthorized [REST]
attributes.description: This field is the unauthorized response type of the service

attributes.name: responseInternalServerError [REST]
attributes.description: This field is the internal server error response type of the service

attributes.name: requestBody [REST]
attributes.description: This field is the body of the request

attributes.name: pathVariables [REST]
attributes.description: These are the path variables that are sent in the request

attributes.name: exampleCodes [Functional]
attributes.description: These will be the example codes of the functionality

attributes.name: attributes [Functional]
attributes.description: These are the attributes that the functionality can have

elements.name: ExampleCode
elements.description: Entity to create a code sample

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Code section title

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Code section description

attributes.name: code
attributes.description: Example code

attributes.name: out
attributes.description: Example out code

attributes.name: language
attributes.description: Sample code language

elements.name: Attribute
elements.description: Entity to create a new documentation attribute

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Attribute name

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Attribute data type

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Attribute description

attributes.name: default
attributes.description: Attribute default value

elements.name: PathVariable
elements.description: Entity to document the path variable of a REST service

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Path variable name

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Placeholder description text

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Type of the value of which the field will be

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Default value that the field will have

attributes.name: dateFormat
attributes.description: If the field is of type date you can put a specific format

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Determine if the form will make the field required

elements.name: help
elements.description: Comando para mostrar en pantalla un mapeo de todos los comandos disponibles por Urxnium CLI
